paper_title.en: Purification of microcystins by DEAE and C-18 cartridge chromatography

description.en: Microcystins (MCs) were purified by DEAE and Cls cartridge chromatography. Addition of EtOH to the eluents (20%) in DEAE chromatography gave higher resolution than no addition of EtOH. The chromatogram showed three peaks: MC-LR; MC-LY and MC-LF; MC-LW. MC-LR and NIC-LW were obtained by one step chromatography with purity of 96 and 88%, respectively. The separation of MC-LF and MC-LW with DEAE chromatography was better than that with reversed-phase chromatography. MC-LY and MC-LF were separated with C-18 cartridge. On the chromatogram, there were three peaks consisting of MC-LY (81% purity), MC-LF (86%), and an unknown compound which was considered as a MC variant judging from the results in HPLC/PDA, FAB-MS, and H-1 NMR analyses, but the structure could not be determined. It is concluded that the combination of DEAE and Cls cartridge chromatography would be a practical approach for the purification of various MCs. (C) 2001 Elsevier Science Ltd. All rights reserved.

description.en: Microcystins (MCs) were purified by DEAE and Cls cartridge chromatography. paper_title.ja: 三保半島で捕集した大気エアロゾル中の水溶性成分の季節変動
paper_title.en: Seasonal Fluctuation of Water Soluble Components in the Atmospheric Aerosol collected at Miho Peninsula in Shizuoka Prefecture, Japan

description.ja: 対岸に工場地帯がある三保半島で, 大気エアロゾルを1年半にわたりローボリュームサンプラーで連続捕集した。日本の平均的な大気エアロゾルの化学組成と比較し, 本モニタリングステーションの大気エアロゾルには, NaとV濃度が高いという特徴が見られた。大気エアロゾル中のAl, Feの水溶性の割合は15%以下と小さかったが, Na, Mg, V, Zn, Cu, Pbは, 50%以上が水溶性で存在し, 海塩由来と人為由来であることを示唆していた。風向別解析から, 工場群が存在する北成分の風が優先する時, それら水溶性重金属類の濃度が高くなることがわかった。しかし, 水溶性Vとその他の重金属類とは相関関係がなく, 同じ人為起源系元素でも発生源が異なると推定された。
description.en: Atmospheric aerosol were collected by a low volume sampler for one and half a year during the period of 1997-1998 at the Miho Peninsula station in Shizuoka prefecture, Japan. A number of factories are located to the north and west of the sampling station. The station faces the sea in the south and the east directions. NH<SUP>+</SUP><SUB>4</SUB>, Cl<SUP>-</SUP> NO<SUP>-</SUP><SUB>3</SUB>, SO<SUP>2-</SUP><SUB>4</SUB> Na, Mg, Al, K, Ca, V, Fe, Cu, Zn and Pb in the samples were determined by an ion chromatograph and an ICP/AES. A comparison of the average concentration of those components in the samples with the average of 16 national stations in Japan showed that the atmospheric aerosol at Miho station contains higher concentrations of Na and V than the averages. Furthermore, various heavy elements in the sample showed high percentages of the water soluble fraction, such as Ca (97%), Na (96%), K (88%), V (86%), Zn (85%), Mg (83%), Pb (60%), Cu (53%), Fe (13%) and Al (12%) . The concentrations of water soluble fractions of V, Zn and Pb were found to increase when the wind came from the north. This suggests that those metals in the atmospheric aerosol come from anthropogenic activities. The water soluble Zn and Pb showed clear correlation with the monthly fluctuation of NH<SUP>-</SUP><SUB>4</SUB> and NO<SUP>-</SUP><SUB>3</SUB>. The water soluble V did not correlate with other elements, suggesting a independent nature of a source of V from those of Zn and Pb.

description.ja: 対岸に工場地帯がある三保半島で, 大気エアロゾルを1年半にわたりローボリュームサンプラーで連続捕集した。日本の平均的な大気エアロゾルの化学組成と比較し, 本モニタリングステーションの大気エアロゾルには, NaとV濃度が高いという特徴が見られた。大気エアロゾル中のAl, Feの水溶性の割合は15%以下と小さかったが, Na, Mg, V, Zn, Cu, Pbは, 50%以上が水溶性で存在し, 海塩由来と人為由来であることを示唆していた。風向別解析から, 工場群が存在する北成分の風が優先する時, それら水溶性重金属類の濃度が高くなることがわかった。しかし, 水溶性Vとその他の重金属類とは相関関係がなく, 同じ人為起源系元素でも発生源が異なると推定された。
description.en: Atmospheric aerosol were collected by a low volume sampler for one and half a year during the period of 1997-1998 at the Miho Peninsula station in Shizuoka prefecture, Japan. A number of factories are located to the north and west of the sampling station. The station faces the sea in the south and the east directions. A comparison of the average concentration of those components in the samples with the average of 16 national stations in Japan showed that the atmospheric aerosol at Miho station contains higher concentrations of Na and V than the averages. Furthermore, various heavy elements in the sample showed high percentages of the water soluble fraction, such as Ca (97%), Na (96%), K (88%), V (86%), Zn (85%), Mg (83%), Pb (60%), Cu (53%), Fe (13%) and Al (12%) . The concentrations of water soluble fractions of V, Zn and Pb were found to increase when the wind came from the north. This suggests that those metals in the atmospheric aerosol come from anthropogenic activities. The water soluble Zn and Pb showed clear correlation with the monthly fluctuation of NH<SUP>-</SUP><SUB>4</SUB> and NO<SUP>-</SUP><SUB>3</SUB>. The water soluble V did not correlate with other elements, suggesting a independent nature of a source of V from those of Zn and Pb.
